newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian shares claw higher, sharp drop in volumes.
newsitem.headline: Indian shares claw higher, sharp drop in volumes.

text.p: ** (1215 GMT) - India bourses end mixed, lacklustre trade
** Bombay's benchmark index up 9.17 points, or 0.26
percent, to close at 3,492.65, off 3,512.40--day's high
** Foreign funds major buyers in multinational, hotel and
** Peregrine says Indian stocks to outperform Asia markets
** National exchange index up 1.15 pts to 1,002.15
** Delhi share index gains 1.90 pts to 746.35, Calcutta
falls 0.96 pts to 451.55 and Madras 0.62 pts to 3,363.49

Shares at Indian bourses drifted in positive territory on Thursday in a session that lacked direction, but select buying interest by foreign funds helped blue chips nose ahead near the close, dealers said.
"Fund action was typically in multinational stocks. A lot of fresh positions are slowly being created," said Dilip Joshi, equities dealer at Bombay's Prime Brokerage, a domestic firm.

The Bombay Stock Exchange's 30-share index ended below the 3,500 mark, up 9.17 points over Wednesday's close. Trading volumes at the Bombay bourse fell nearly 35 percent to 4.26 billion in sluggish market activity.
